page.title: 04The Archaeological Dig
page.content: On the outskirts of Dorchester a site is being excavated by the Trust for Wessex Archaeology, using MSC labour. It was decided to dig here because artefacts were found when the railway was laid in the 19th century, and more recently when the Trumpet Major car park was extended. The diggers have found many things, including an{Iron Age}settlement, {Roman}granaries and some cemeteries which were in use for 3-4 thousand years! Most of the bodies were buried facing South, and some showed burial rituals such as coins on eyelids or tongue. Many were in coffins, and one had wrists and ankles tied and a stone was clasped between the hands. Soon, 500 houses will be built on the site of the 'dig' so it will be obliterated.
